title: Expected multi-utility representations of preferences over lotteries. (arXiv:2210.04739v2 [math.CA] UPDATED)
abstract: Let $\succsim$ be a binary relation on the set of simple lotteries over a countable outcome set $Z$. We provide necessary and sufficient conditions on $\succsim$ to guarantee the existence of a set $U$ of von Neumann--Morgenstern utility functions $u: Z\to \mathbf{R}$ such that $$ p\succsim q \,\,\,\Longleftrightarrow\,\,\, \mathbf{E}_p[u] \ge \mathbf{E}_q[u] \,\text{ for all }u \in U $$ for all simple lotteries $p,q$. In such case, the set $U$ is essentially unique. Then, we show that the analogue characterization does not hold if $Z$ is uncountable. This provides an answer to an open question posed by Dubra, Maccheroni, and Ok in [J. Econom. Theory~\textbf{115} (2004), no.~1, 118--133]. Lastly, we show that different continuity requirements on $\succsim$ allow for certain restrictions on the possible choices of the set $U$ of utility functions (e.g., all utility functions are bounded), providing a wide family of expected multi-utility representations.

translated_title: 对抽签偏好的期望多效用表示的研究
translated_abstract: 设$\succsim$为定义在可数结果集$Z$上的简单抽签集上的二元关系。我们提供了对$\succsim$的必要和充分条件，以保证存在一组von Neumann--Morgenstern效用函数$u: Z\to \mathbf{R}$，使得对于所有简单抽签$p,q$，有$$ p\succsim q \,\,\,\Longleftrightarrow\,\,\, \mathbf{E}_p[u] \ge \mathbf{E}_q[u] \,\text{ for all }u \in U $$在这种情况下，该集合$U$是基本唯一的。然后，我们证明如果$Z$是可数集，此类模型的模拟特征不存在。这解答了Dubra、Maccheroni和Ok在[J. Econom. Theory~\textbf{115} (2004), no.~1, 118--133]中提出的一个问题。最后，我们表明不同的连续性要求对$\succsim$允许对选择集$U$的某些限制（例如，所有效用函数都有界），从而提供了广泛的期望多效用表示的家族。
tldr: 本文研究了对抽签偏好的期望多效用表示，提供了必要和充分条件，并证明了在可数结果集上满足这种条件的效用函数集合是唯一的。此外，我们还回答了一个关于模拟特征的开放问题，并展示了在不同连续性要求下对效用函数集合的限制，从而提供了广泛的期望多效用表示的家族。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the expected multi-utility representations of preferences over lotteries. It provides necessary and sufficient conditions for the existence of a unique set of utility functions satisfying certain properties. It also answers an open question regarding the existence of such representations in the case of an uncountable outcome set. Additionally, the paper explores the impact of different continuity requirements on the possible choices of utility functions, leading to a wide family of expected multi-utility representations.
